question: Who has been appointed as the new Chief Justice of Pakistan?
explanation: On 2 January 2019, President Arif Alvi appointed Justice Asif Saeed Khosa as the new Chief Justice of Pakistan (CJP). Khosa will succeed Mian  Saqib Nisar on 18th January and will remain at seat till December 20, 2019. The Chief Justice of Pakistan (CJP)  is the head of the court system of Pakistan (the judicature branch of government) and the chief judge of the Supreme Court of Pakistan. He  is responsible for supervising federal judicial policies, and conducting judicial business in the Supreme Court.
